intro: Rorippa heterophylla, commonly known as the water lentil or narrow-leafed watercress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, aquatic or semi-aquatic species that typically grows in wetlands, pond margins, and damp soils. The plant features alternate, linear to lanceolate leaves that vary in shape depending on the growth conditions. Its small white or yellowish flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Rorippa heterophylla is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in fluctuating water levels, making it an important species in aquatic ecosystems.
